How much alcohol is beneficial to the health today?

According to the Dietary Guidelines for Americans from the Dietary Guidelines Advisory Committee, drinking in moderation is defined as up to one drink per day for women and up to two drinks per day for men. However, it is important to note that even moderate drinking can still increase the risk of short-term and long-term health problems, including cardiovascular disease, stroke, liver disease, and various types of cancer. It is also important to keep in mind that drinking alcohol is not appropriate for everyone. If you choose to drink, it is important to monitor and limit your intake.
